results.title: The Insurance story
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris, Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service
results.brief_description: Traces the history of insurance, origin of “underwriting”, and looks at the many fields in which insurance is available. Shows the work of a typical insurance office and the procedure following a claim. Narrated by Geoff McComas.

results.title: The Instructional guide to dating
results.creator_credit: Siobhan Bowers, Stuart Parkyn and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
There are many hazards to avoid in the airport of love. How do you choose a co-pilot to take on your journey? What is the best way to eject from a date that’s in a tailspin? How do you avoid excess emotional baggage?
The Instructional Guide to Dating is essential for every modern girl and hipster guy to navigate through the turbulent modern dating scene.

results.title: The Inside view
results.creator_credit: Edward Poulter, Richard Reisz and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Illustrates the medical advances taking place which allow us literally to look inside the human body. There are various methods, all operable by way of the computer. An image of a living foetus inside the womb can be created and early heart trouble or cancer growth can be detected.

results.title: The Inquisitive giant
results.brief_description: Introduces a study of radio astronomy with a brief survey of the development of the optical telescope, from the early instruments of Galileo, Newton and Hershell to the giant modern telescopes of Mt Wilson and Palomar. Shows work in radio astronomy in many lands, focussing on British work. Shows the design and building of the steerable radio telescope at Jodrell Bank. Shots of the nebula of Andromeda, and of the Sun during eclipse, views of the giant but delicate instruments, show the magnitude of subject matter and tools in astronomy.

results.title: The Innocent condemned
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: in the garden of Gethsemane, Jesus talks to the Father; Judas betrays Jesus with a kiss; Jesus is arrested and taken away; Judas is given his money by Zerah; Jesus is taken before the high priest and questioned; Caiaphas is outraged by his answers; Peter denies Jesus three times; Judas is found hanged; Jesus is questioned by Pontius Pilate; Jesus is whipped by the soldiers; Jesus is mocked and crowned with thorns.

results.title: The Inner planets
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Media Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Uses special effects to create an impression of what is known of the structural character of the inner planets - Mercury, Venus and Mars. explains why life cannot be sustained on these planets. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Inner man steps out
results.creator_credit: Robert Wilmot, Henry Strauss and Pathescope Company of America
results.brief_description: A supervisor who knows the “book rules” for human relations finds himself in trouble when trying to apply them to people on the job. Points out the things a man with supervisory responsibility needs to know about the way different people react to different situations, and the use he can make of this knowledge to improve his own job function and that of the people he supervises.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Wilmot, Henry Strauss and Pathescope Company of America
